page.title: 12BLACKMORE VALE FARMING TREND
page.content: This area,formerly known for its high milk production continues to supply as much milk as the quota system will permit.It is collected by tanker for the Wincanton creamery or Sturminster cheese factory.Less hay and silage are needed for reduced milk herds so more beef cattle are being reared. Again on 2 farms on the east side of the area 300 and 700 pigs are being fattened intensively for bacon and in the south-west a flock of 300 breeding ewes are kept. Three areas have roughly half the farmland used for arable crops mainly wheat and barley with a few oats.Some of this is used for silage,especially as bad weather upset the harvesting. Most of the livestock is bought and sold at Sturminster Newton cattle market,the biggest calf market in England.Pigs go to local bacon factory
